item.title: Rubbish still there after clean up, 10th October
item.description:
Thank you for clearing up the bags of rubbish. I'm afraid there is still quite a lot left in the gutter and around the pavement. See the attached photo

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gunton Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Dead branches, 10th October
item.description:
As you drive down Hayes Lane towards the Chinese roundabout there are a number of long, thin dead branches down the side of the road that could be removed. They could be a problem for cyclists if they blew into the road. There is also litter in the bushes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Hayes Lane, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 10th October
item.description:
There is a constant littering and fly tipping issue since Hackney Council decided to move the commercial bins for the nearby parade of shops. Please can they organise to move back as itâ€™s a real eyesore for local residents.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many Potholes, 10th October
item.description:

item.title: Asbestos and green waste not yet picked up, 10th October
item.description:
I filed a previous report re excess of leaves. Thank you for collecting! But no one has retrieved any of the green waste bags in over 2 months. There is also recently dumped wall installation which could be dangerous to have around children walking by.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mill Row, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metal fencing of the pedestrian crossing has been all cut open and leaving metal bits sticking ot of the ground coursing trip hazards, 10th October
item.description:
The metal fencing that comes of western way public highway crossing at traffic lights has been cut out at the bottom leaving the safety fencing wide open coursing cars to drive into birchmere park which is unsafe for pedestrians plus we're they have cut it at the bottom there is now metal sharp trip hazard. Needs repairs asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in the carpark area Barrowfield Close N9, 10th October
item.description:
There is flytipped rubbish including a sofa in the carpark area in Barrowfield Close N9 near to Granville Avenue N9 junction been there for sometime and has been seen by council rubbish vans in fact a team sat next to the pile for a good half an hour and done nothing about it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barrowfield Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
